newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Mobil says suspends maintenance at aromatics plant.
newsitem.headline: Mobil says suspends maintenance at aromatics plant.

text.p: Mobil Singapore, a unit of Mobil Corp of the U.S. said on Tuesday it has suspended maintenance work at its aromatics plant following a gas leak.
The 280,000 barrels-per-day refinery has been shut down for scheduled maintenance since March 15. The work was due to last for up to six weeks.
A Mobil spokesman said Mobil personnel and contractors were carrying out maintenance work at a unit in the aromatics plant when they were overcome by fumes on Monday.
"The cause of the leak is under investigation and all works on the aromatics complex have been suspended," the spokesman said.
The Singapore Civil Defence Force said in a separate statement that one man died and six were injured after the gas leak. One casualty was seriously injured, Mobil said.
The refinery also had a flash fire on March 25, which was extinguished in a few minutes. The SCDF said there was also another fire earlier today which was brought under control after 27 minutes.
The SCDF said it suspected the gas leak was hydrogen sulphide. It said there were six casualties other than the man who died.
